channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: USAID enabled 208 Afghan women to defy the Taliban ban on college -- until now
item.description: A USAID grant enabled them to either study online or enroll in college in another country. Now the grant has been terminated.

item.title: House GOP leaders prep vote on budget despite rift within the party
item.description: Republicans in Congress are closer to passing key elements of President Trump's legislative agenda — like extending tax cuts that expire at the end of...

item.title: 'We love them': Small N.Y. town embraces a family freed from immigration detention
item.description: "I get goose bumps," said school principal Jamie Cook, thinking about the community rallying to support the family. The three students and their mothe...

item.title: What is Tren de Aragua's footprint in the U.S.? Experts say smaller than federal officials say
item.description: Unreliable federal gang data and a heavy reliance on tattoos and clothing styles can skew the picture of this Venezuelan gang's operations in America.

item.title: A biotech company says it has bred three pups with traits of the extinct dire wolf
item.description: Colossal Biosciences says it used novel gene-editing technology to alter gray wolf DNA to breed the animals. Dire wolves recently featured prominently...

item.title: Democratic-led cities and states push back on threats to cut US school funding over DEI
item.description: Some Democratic-led states and cities are pushing back on a Trump administration threat to cut education funding over diversity, equity, and inclusion...

item.title: China calls JD Vance "ignorant and impolite" over his "peasants" comments
item.description: A spokesperson for China's foreign ministry hit back at Vice President JD Vance after Vance referred multiple times to "Chinese peasants" in a Fox New...

item.title: Supreme Court blocks order requiring Trump administration to reinstate thousands of federal workers
South Korea says about 10 North Korean troops crossed their border
item.description: South Korea fired warning shots after, Seoul says, North Korean troops crossed their border. The soldiers then went back to the North, Seoul said.

item.title: South Florida student born deaf excels in school thanks to determination
item.description: Edmund Polinski was recently awarded the President's Award for Outstanding Academic Excellence.

item.title: White House says 104% tariff on China will take effect Wednesday
item.description: China will face a 104% tariff on goods beginning Wednesday, the White House confirmed.

item.title: National Park Service restores original Harriet Tubman, Underground Railroad webpage
Roof collapse at Dominican Republic nightclub kills dozens
item.description: Rescue workers are searching for survivors beneath the rubble of the nightclub in Santo Domingo.

item.title: Ukraine captures two Chinese nationals fighting for Russia
item.description: President Zelensky says two soldiers were captured while fighting in Ukraine's Donetsk region.

item.title: World must act now to help Gazans under Israeli blockade, UN chiefs urge
item.description: Israel has blocked humanitarian supplies and fuel from entering for five weeks - the longest period since the war began.

item.title: Musk labels Trump trade adviser 'moron' over Tesla comments
item.description: Peter Navarro had described Musk's electric car company as a "car assembler" rather than manufacturer.

item.title: Zelensky confirms Ukraine troops in Russia's Belgorod region
item.description: Ukraine's operations in a second region in Russia are explicitly acknowledged for the first time.

item.title: Volcano eruption in the Philippines sends ash miles into the air
item.description: The area around Kanlaon Volcano in the Philippines was still under evacuation orders from an eruption in December​.
